title: Pakistan Army chief comment that Masood Azhar is not dead, he is alive in our hearts was a satirical post by a Parody Account
subtitle: The source of the information being posted by many users on Facebook is a parody account which posts satirical and parody content. So, the claim that Pakistan Army Chief really making this statement FALSE
author: factly.in
vclaim:
A post is being shared by many users on Facebook claiming Pakistan Army chief has commented on the death of founder and leader of the terrorist organisation Jaish-e-Mohammed, Masood Azhar. Let’s try to analyze the claim made in the post.

Claim: Pakistan Army Chief: “Masood Azhar is not dead, he is alive in our hearts”. Fact: The source of the information being posted by many users on Facebook is a parody account which posts satirical and parody content. So, the claim made is FALSE.

When searched for the statements said to be made by Pakistan Army Chief Bajwa on Google, a link to ‘Limes of India’ post can be found in the search results. The description of the account on Twitter shows that the page posts only fake tweets. So, the content of the tweets should not be taken seriously.

Finally, there is no truth in the post. It’s just a satirical take on the Pakistan Army Chief.
